title: Media briefing on Ariane 6’s inaugural flight
summary: Watch the replay of the Ariane 6 inaugural flight pre-launch media briefing to learn more about the first flight of Europe’s new heavy lift launch vehicle.

title: Gateway: Up Close in Stunning Detail
summary: Witness Gateway in stunning detail with this video that brings the future of lunar exploration to life.

title: Jupiter’s upper atmosphere surprises astronomers
summary: Using the NASA/ESA/CSA James Webb Space Telescope, scientists observed the region above Jupiter’s iconic Great Red Spot to discover a variety of previously unseen features. The region, previously believed to be unremarkable in nature, hosts a variety of intricate structures and activity.

title: ESA Signs Off on Argonaut Lunar Lander Engine Test
summary: An ESA-led Test Review Board has signed off on a hot fire test campaign of an engine being developed by ArianeGroup for the European Argonaut lunar lander. First called the European Large Logistic Lander (EL3), Argonaut is designed to be a multi-use lunar lander capable of carrying payloads of between 1,500 and 1,800 kilograms to […]

title: Chang’e-6 delivers first lunar far side samples to Earth after 53-day mission
summary: The Chang'e-6 return capsule reentered Earth’s atmosphere early Tuesday, safely delivering unique lunar material expected to provide unique insights into the evolution of the moon.

title: Another Spacewalk Scrub for NASA Astronauts
summary: For the second time in a row, NASA had to scrub a spacewalk today.  In this case, water began leaking from NASA astronaut Tracy Dyson’s spacesuit as she and Mike […]

title: Launch Roundup: Falcon Heavy returns with GOES-U, Firefly launches an Alpha
summary: Following a week in which Tropical Storm Alberto brought high seas, wind, and rain-related delays to the launch schedule in Florida, SpaceX hopes to get back on track this week with launches planned for all three of the active Falcon launch pads, including a Falcon Heavy.

title: Sir Peter Beck unplugged: “Transporter can do it for free for all we care”
summary: "Look, there's no accidental monopoly. They are a ruthless competitor."

title: Firefly to launch Alpha from Wallops
summary: Firefly Aerospace announced June 24 it plans to launch its Alpha rocket from the same pad at Wallops Island, Virginia, used by the Antares rocket, rather than from Cape Canaveral as previously planned.

title: U.S. Space Command sees promise in rocket cargo initiative
summary: Gen. Stephen Whiting: "Let's let the demonstrations continue”
